conditions: Type 2 Diabetes (newly diagnosed 3 months ago, poorly controlled), Obesity (BMI 34), Prediabetic neuropathy (tingling in feet)
medications: Metformin 500mg twice daily (prescribed but not taking regularly), Multivitamin daily
goals: Avoid having to take insulin. Wants to manage diabetes through diet and exercise if possible. Would like to lose weight but finds it difficult.
concerns: Feet have been tingling and sometimes numb. Frustrated that diet changes haven't worked quickly enough. Doesn't want to increase medications. Worried about long-term complications like his father who had diabetes and lost a leg.
personality: Resistant and somewhat defensive about lifestyle changes. Tends to minimize symptoms. Skeptical of medications. Can be curt or dismissive when feeling judged. Needs motivational interviewing approach.
